casebody.data: No. 9418. J. C. Thompson et al. vs. Louis A. Fasnacht. A tax sale under an assessment in the name of the estate of a deceased person, when it appears that the heirs of such decedenthad been formally put in possession of his estate by a judgment of court eight years before the assessment was made, and besides, have been in actual possession thereof from the time of such judgment until the sale, is null, hut the purchaser is entitled to he reimbursed the sura paid by him for taxes at the sale. [NO OPINION]
